channel.title: Detecting a call with modem
channel.description:
It really pisses me off when people call and I'm listening to music because I don't hear the phone ring, so I thought of writing a program that mutes my computer when there is a phone call.
I can connect the computer to the phone line using a 56k modem.
How would I detect a call using Java? I can do all the other stuff easily.

item.title: Detecting a call with modem
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

an interesting question, im not sure if you can do this with a non modified modem or custom hardware, because i dont know enough about the interface to know if it gives you that low level access

most 56k modems (all?) support auto answer (give it ats0=1 in a terminal after the handshake and ring the line) but obviously that picks up the phone. we used to use it here as a cheap answer phone years ago because we were too cheap to buy one

if you were going to do it with custom hardware it wouldnt be too difficult but definitely more of a rainy day project than a practical thing. you might be able to do it with a modem thought, take a look at the specs.

edit: if you wanted a code challenge more than a hardware one, have you considered detecting the ring via audio?
